result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Competency hearing on November 15, 2022 at 11:15 am.

9:17 AM Defendant Edmond J Green Jr in court.  Attorney Emily M Nolan-Plutchak in court for Edmond J Green Jr.  Prosecuting attorney David R. Knaapen in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Nolan Plutchak is requesting the Court order a competency evaluation.  

Court so orders.    Bond is continued.

9:16 AM Defendant Edmond J Green Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.

Court questions regarding supervised home where defendant resides. Victim's mother makes a statement that the home is not secure.  Court orders owner of the supervised living facility to install an alarm on the door of the home.  Owner states that she will have that done by the end of the day.
